WRITING.TITLE: The Oculus in New York - Sony a7III with 50mm 1.8 - Trying to learn how to help inexperienced models pose

WRITING.TEXT: I would try to either fill the frame with the duckling you want to focus on or try to step back and not cut off the duckling's face on the right.

I'm looking for advice on how to pose a model who isn't used to modeling. I'm used to light edits on Lightroom but I tried using Photoshop to darken the background and make the subject pop using a brightness filter and masking out the subject. If you all have any advice on better methods of using Photoshop to highlight a subject I'd be interested to hear it! Sorry I realized in retrospect this was shot with the kit zoom lens at 29mm, F3.5, 1/400sec, ISO 3200. This explains why the background isn't very blurred.

Thanks for the advice! I definitely will look into some high pass tutorials. It makes sense to try to get more shots without people to combine the images together. In the future I'll see if I can wait or just get to the location earlier without tons of people. As for poses I guess I better start scrolling through Instagram!
That ray of light looks so perfect. Did you add it in post?

WRITING.TITLE: Using Event Photos in Your Portfolio
WRITING.TEXT: Hello everyone, #8203; I wanted to know if I needed permission of everyone in the photos I've taken to post them on my website for portfolio and marketing purposes. I'm a new photographer when it comes to marketing myself and I often take event photos of dance competitions. Some of the dancers I know and can get their consent but I want to take into account the people in the background or photos of dancers I don't know. Sometimes competitors are also under 18 and I wonder if I should exclude them from my online portfolio as well. Or maybe I'm just being too paranoid. Thank you all for your advice.

A really helpful Youtube channel is Tony amp; Chelsea Northrup. Here is a playlist with all their tutorials: [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwIVS3\_dKVpsyZJ-BhsCHwTj8Y6PEAurc](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwIVS3_dKVpsyZJ-BhsCHwTj8Y6PEAurc) and they have plenty more on their channel.
I think that #8217;s King Zack! He has a YouTube channel and was famous on Vine.
Joyeux jour de g #226;teau

Is it just me or is there an algorithm in smash online to make dittos more frequent? I will play and never see a little mac and when I play little mac I suddenly get matched with the same little mac over and over again (even without rematching)

WRITING.TITLE: Water helps with burns but hot water can burn you too
Maybe I don #8217;t want to play games on Facebook mobile
Med Schools that require Calculus
WRITING.TEXT: Hello to you all, I've been heavily considering whether or not I should take calculus before med school. I've been trying to find free comprehensive lists of med schools that require calculus but all I've found are these 2 links: [https://hpa.princeton.edu/sites/hpa/files/2017hpa-mathrequirements.pdf](https://hpa.princeton.edu/sites/hpa/files/2017hpa-mathrequirements.pdf) [https://www.cc-seas.columbia.edu/sites/dsa/files/handbooks/Medical%20Schools%20with%20Additional%20Math%20Requirements%2010\_11.pdf](https://www.cc-seas.columbia.edu/sites/dsa/files/handbooks/Medical%20Schools%20with%20Additional%20Math%20Requirements%2010_11.pdf) These seem outdated and don't cover all the med schools. Anyone have any better luck?
Thanks for making such an amazing client! I've got to say the use of gestures was always really convenient :3

WRITING.TITLE: Lamy 2000 inksplosion - this happens inside the cap after leaving my pen on my desk. Is this normal?

WRITING.TEXT: It #8217;s weird because I can tap it and shake it and nothing happens. But if I walk away and come back sometimes it just has ink all over.
Only for a week. And I got it off Amazon -\_-
That may be it? I find the nob is pretty lose for a bit as I turn it but then it starts moving the piston and it functions normally.
If by O ring you mean the metal one between the feed and the barrel it's still solidly there. Is there supposed to be another O ring in the Lamy 2000?
They're both Lamy! The one on the left is the Lamy 2000. The one on the right is the Lamy Safari.
Thank you! I #8217;ll definitely consider returning it.

WRITING.TITLE: I just love the look of Pilot Iroshizuku bottles

WRITING.TEXT: The pilot usually comes with a squeeze converter that works with the pen. Make sure you #8217;ve tried it out before you buy another converter!

WRITING.TITLE: Dropped my Lamy 2000. Never thought it would happen to me - Any advice on getting a replacement nib?

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for the advice! Would the guarantee still apply if I bought it off Amazon?
I really appreciate it. Unfortunately I already pulled the trigger and bought a replacement nib.
I ended up just buying a replacement nib. It may not have been the most economical but it #8217;s the most straightforward for me. Thank you all for your advice. I really appreciate this community!
You can get ink samples from Gouletpens.com/collections/ink-samples. They #8217;re relatively cheap and allow you to try out the ink yourself!
I feel like the Visconti Homo Sapiens is quite the grail pen for many
I absolutely love the color red. Have you considered adding the Kaweco AL Sport #8220;Deep Red #8221; to your new collection?

WRITING.TITLE: My First Red Pen!

WRITING.TEXT: So far it doesn #8217;t feel too heavy in the hand at all. The classics I #8217;ve tried always felt too light and flimsy to me. For reference it feels slightly heavier than my Lamy Vista.

When I had trouble with my Lamy 2000 and asked this subreddit people told me to email Lamy in your region. The Lamy 2000 has a lifetime guarantee and I would think it should be fixed for free (hopefully). Or you could try this web-page to contact them: [https://www.lamy.com/en/contact/](https://www.lamy.com/en/contact/)
I believe all Kaweco #8217;s have the same steel nibs, so they should all write the same (including the all black version). The only exception are the rare gold Kaweco nibs I see here and there.

Hi there! I also own a Vanishing Point in Fine, and I noticed if I didn't hold the nib completely flat while writing it would feel quite scratchy. But if I rotate the pen and made sure the nib was not turned it would write smooth like butter. For me it was a matter of getting used to having the clip in the way as I hold my pen with my thumb on top of the pen. Just mess around with the pen as much as you can to see if you can get something to work before spending money or altering your pen in any way. If this doesn't work for you, it's possible to use a magnifier glass to see if the tines (the two parts of your nib) are misaligned. Or you could use a micro-mesh to smooth out the nib (which can be quite risky). Here is a tutorial if you were curious: [https://youtu.be/r35cV\_pe0-Q](https://youtu.be/r35cV_pe0-Q) Overall since using a micro-mesh voids your warranty and you're dealing with an expensive gold nib, going to a nibmeister may be your best bet if changing your writing angle doesn't work.

WRITING.TITLE: I #8217;m welcoming the Lamy Studio to my family of fountain pens

WRITING.TEXT: In chronological order from most recent to oldest - Lamy Studio - Kaweco AL Sport - Pilot VP - Muji Fountain Pen - Pilot Metro - Lamy Vista

I do have an EF nib on the Kaweco. It is quite fine. Because of how small it is there is a noticeable feedback while writing but I still love it and would recommend. I do use it with the piston converter that works quite well.
Thank you! I hope you thoroughly enjoy your Kaweco!
How would one go about buying just the Imporium nib?

WRITING.TITLE: Smoothest Fountain Pen Nibs Out There
WRITING.TEXT: Hello r/fountainpens, I've been shopping for smooth nibs for awhile now and I was curious to know what you all thought are some of the smoothest nibs out there. Here is my experience so far \- Lamy 2000 in Medium is extremely smooth and writes very wet \- Pilot Vanishing Point Fine is also smooth and wet, but less than the Lamy 2000 \- Lamy Studio Fine is somewhat toothy with a decent amount of feedback. Has trouble writing under it's own weight \- Lamy Vista with 1.1 Steel Stub is quite smooth as long as you hold it correctly (don't dig the edges into the page) \- Pilot Metropolitan Fine is the smoothest steel nib I've tried. Writes just fine with it's own weight and no pressure \- Kaweco AL Sport EF has a decent amount of feedback but still feels smooth for an EF What are your thoughts and experiences? Do you find a significant difference between steel and gold nibs?
How would you rate the writing experience compared to your VP?
What is that beautiful pen on the left? Ama-Iro is also one of my favorite blues!

WRITING.TITLE: Starting off the semester with my two favorite pens

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m using a medium nib on the Lamy 2000 with Pilot Iroshizuku Shin-Kai and a Fine nib on the VP with Pilot Iroshizuku Kon-Peki

WRITING.TITLE: They just keep multiplying

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m curious to know where you bought these. I find the price varies from Amazon to goldspot or endless pens. Even my local pen shop has a different price for Sailor pens. I want to find a good deal but still support the right people with my money.
I recognize the Pelikan and the Lamy 2k but I #8217;m curious to know the rest. Truly a beautiful lineup.

The same thing happened to me and I freaked out. I soon realized that parts of my house are really cold and other parts are much warmer. Going from a cold to warm place will expand the air in the pen and push out the ink. If the pen is full of ink there #8217;s less air to expand when the temp changes. Try keeping the pen at the same temp for a few days and see if the burping stops.
Beautiful pen! I #8217;m curious to know what #8217;s the difference between this pen and the Pilot Falcon/Namiki falcon. The nibs look like they #8217;re almost the same.
Pilot Iroshizuku Shin Kai is my favorite blue black by Pilot.

WRITING.TITLE: Nibs.com personal tuning, is it worth it?
WRITING.TEXT: I noticed that some websites like nibs.com claims they can personalize your pens based on how much pressure you use and how much ink flow you prefer. I #8217;m considering soon getting a Visconti HS and I wanted to know if people had good or bad reviews about Nibs.com and their tuning. Thank you in advance!
The Lamy Studio is also an all metal pen. The limited editions have a nice rubbery grip that I find quite pleasant.

WRITING.TITLE: I took the dive (NPD Visconti Homo Sapiens Bronze Age EF)

WRITING.TEXT: So far I #8217;d say yes. The nib is insanely smooth and springy with a touch of line variation. The feel of the body is truly unique and it #8217;s also my first vacuum filler pen. It #8217;s an absolute joy to hold and write with.
I have the gold nib. I #8217;m also surprised by how thick the extra fine nib writes.
A fellow appreciator of bokeh I see. I used a 50mm at 1.8
The standard price for a new one is $620 from most places I #8217;ve seen.
I can post again maybe tomorrow with some writing samples and comparisons.

I was actually able to get my hands on it in person before buying it at my local pen shop. If you happen to live in the Boston MA area Bromfield pen shop has a few Visconti #8217;s available for anyone to try!
They currently only have a magma in EF left in stock. I was lucky and snagged their last Bronze Age.

WRITING.TITLE: Here #8217;s a quick writing sample for the Visconti HS Bronze Age (EF) per some people #8217;s request

WRITING.TEXT: This is the gold nib

Hey there! I #8217;ve had the chance to own a Visconti HS and try the Pelikan m1000 in store. I was making the same decision as you a week ago. I ended up picking the Visconti because I liked the soft gold nib and the feel of the basaltic lava over the hard but smooth nib of the Pelikan. But that #8217;s just my opinion.

WRITING.TITLE: The tines on my new Visconti HS seem misaligned. Is this something I should risk trying to fix myself or should I use my warranty?

WRITING.TEXT: I just put a loupe next to my phone camera and took the picture!
I #8217;m curious to know what focal length you used! Also did you add the vignette on the top corners and the bottom in post?

WRITING.TITLE: I #8217;m in love

WRITING.TEXT: Yup! Gold EF! It #8217;s super smooth for an EF and pretty juicy. It has a touch of line variation but I #8217;m never going to flex this too much.
Mine is still less than two weeks old, but I have polished it a couple times. I also think the lighting makes it look more shiny than it really is.
The Noodlers line up of pens are a good starting point. The Creeper, Ahab and Triple Tail are all pretty good.
What are you writing to use up all that ink? Now I #8217;m curious!
Some of my favorites are from the pilot iroshizuku line. Kon-peki and Shin-Kai are great (blue and blue black).

WRITING.TITLE: While stuck at home it #8217;s tempting to buy another pen. I #8217;m trying my best to enjoy the amazing pens I already have and give my wallet a break.

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m using Oxford Optik paper
Being able to see how much ink I have left would be a blessing

The Kaweco nibs are pretty good but they only feel comfortable for me when you put the cap on the back. Other good starter pens include the Pilot Metropolitan (which is metal) and the Lamy Safari (which is plastic). The Lamy 2000 is an amazing pen but mine seems to write quite thick for a Medium. I recommend learning what nib sizes you like before investing in a pen like the 2000 only to find you don #8217;t like the line width.

I love it so much! The smooth springy nib is great to write with. I did find the pen is so thick it couldn #8217;t fit into my smaller ink bottles (iroshizuku 15ml) so I had to buy a separate inkwell.
Oh noooo (jk). I #8217;m curious to know what you decided to order! I hope it brings you great joy.
Ooh the Coloverse Inks look beautiful!

The Visconti EF is very springy and smooth with a hint audible of feedback. The Pilot F draws a finer line and is a bit less springy and very smooth with almost no feedback. The Lamy Studio F has noticeable feedback and is a tad less smooth than the other two.

WRITING.TITLE: I learned cursive as a kid and I #8217;ve continued to use it every day. It has changed over time but I want to make it look better.
